title: Using LendingTree Inc. (ticker: TREE) 10-K for FY2024 and Damodaran data on margins of US companies by sector (as of January 2025) calculate how LendingTree adjusted EBITDA margin compare to industry-average EBITDA margin. Use as-reported aEBITDA for LendingTree. Assume the industry is Financial Svcs. (Non-bank & Insurance). Provide the absolute difference between company's FY2024 aEBITDA margin and industry average as the answer. Show the answer in % rounded to 2 decimals.
description:
1. Extract FY2024 as-reported Adjusted EBITDA (aEBITDA) for LendingTree from its Form 10-K: 
 FY2024 aEBITDA = $104,113 thousand ($104.113 million) 
 
 2. Extract FY2024 total revenue for LendingTree from the same Form 10-K: 
 FY2024 Revenue = $900,219 thousand ($900.219 million). (SEC Form 10-K, FY2024.)
 
 3. Compute LendingTree’s FY2024 aEBITDA margin = aEBITDA / Revenue = $104,113,000 / $900,219,000 = 11.5653% → 11.57% (rounded to 2 decimals). 
 
 4. Retrieve industry-average EBITDA margin (EBITDA/Sales) for Financial Svcs. (Non-bank & Insurance), US companies, as of January 2025: 
 Financial Svcs. (Non-bank & Insurance) EBITDA margin =18.17%. (Damodaran, Margins by Sector (US), January 2025.)
 
 5. Calculate absolute difference between LendingTree’s FY2024 aEBITDA margin and the industry average: |11.57% − 18.17%| = 6.60%

rubric.criteria: FY2024 as-reported Adjusted EBITDA = $104,113 thousand ($104.113 million).
Industry-average EBITDA margin for US-based companies in Financial Svcs. (Non-bank & Insurance) industry (Damodaran data as of Jan 2025, as required in the promt) = 18.17%.
the absolute difference between LendingTree’s FY2024 aEBITDA margin = |11.57% − 18.17%| = 6.60%.
